Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the amount of funding approved for the Secure Fence Act of 2006, stating it was $50 billion when in fact there was no explicit funding and the estimated cost was around $2.1 billion.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it misrepresents the funding and cost of the Secure Fence Act of 2006.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the fence project was completed and didn't cost close to $50 billion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Obama was supposed to build the fence, when in fact the responsibility for constructing the fence fell under the Department of Homeland Security's discretion.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim could have alternative explanations, such as misunderstanding or misinformation about the funding and cost of the Secure Fence Act of 2006.
